meanings.definition: The act of installing or setting in place.
meanings.sent1: The instillation of the new software was completed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The instillation of the artwork in the gallery took hours.
meanings.sent3: The instillation of the giant sculpture caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an instillation of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The instillation of discipline in the classroom was evident.

meanings.definition: The introduction of a liquid drop by drop.
meanings.sent1: The nurse performed the instillation of eye drops carefully.
meanings.sent2: The instillation of essential oils into the diffuser created a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The instillation of the potion was done with precision.
meanings.sent4: The rain was an instillation of nature's tears on the window pane.
meanings.sent5: The instillation of flavor in the soup enhanced its taste.

meanings.definition: The process of infusing or imparting something gradually.
meanings.sent1: The instillation of knowledge in young minds is crucial.
meanings.sent2: The instillation of confidence in the team members boosted morale.
meanings.sent3: The instillation of humor in the speech lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: Her words were an instillation of hope in times of despair.
meanings.sent5: The instillation of positivity in the workplace improved productivity.
